comments:
Version from HEAD with patch from bug#160540 (which fixes other exceptions).

Create new standard make c project (with null indexer), then add there 'svsfnt.h' file from freetype library. Change indexer to full. After a while exception occurs (see below).
When this file is opened in 'DOM AST' view, it tells about IASTProblemDeclaration: Syntax error occurred in ...


org.eclipse.cdt.core.dom.ast.DOMException
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.c.CParameter$CParameterProblem.getType(CParameter.java:45)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.c.PDOMCParameter.<init>(PDOMCParameter.java:54)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.c.PDOMCFunction.<init>(PDOMCFunction.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.dom.c.PDOMCLinkage.addName(PDOMCLinkage.java:131)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.WritablePDOM.addName(WritablePDOM.java:53)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.index.WritableCIndex.addName(WritableCIndex.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullIndexerJob.addToIndex(PDOMFullIndexerJob.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullIndexerJob.addSymbols(PDOMFullIndexerJob.java:220)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullIndexerJob.doParseTU(PDOMFullIndexerJob.java:159)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.PDOMIndexerTask.parseTU(PDOMIndexerTask.java:122)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullIndexerJob.parseTUs(PDOMFullIndexerJob.java:124)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.indexer.full.PDOMFullReindex.run(PDOMFullReindex.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.pdom.PDOMIndexerJob.run(PDOMIndexerJob.java:68)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

When bindings are persisted, a check is performed to see whether they are problem bindings - if so they are skipped.

The check does not look at whether child bindings are problem bindings - i.e. in the case of a function/method if parameters are problem bindings then this error will be thrown at the moment (as problem bindings typically just throw DOMExceptions when queried for any information)

If this is correct, then we probably should expand the check (?)

Good question. The check for problem binding is really just a speed up since, if it is a problem binding, nothing else will work.

I'd say that in the case of parameters being problem bindings, you should probably add the checks in where needed as opposed to skipping the binding all together. I think...
